laden.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: heavily loaded with something, or containing a lot of something
laden.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: The tables were laden with food.
laden.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: having a lot of a particular quality, thing etc
laden.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: She was laden with doubts about the affair.
laden.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: loaded with a particular material or substance
laden.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: No laden tanker over 10,000 gross tonnes is permitted to pass through the area.
a lorry laden with 4 tonnes of waste paper
laden.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: a ship that is laden in bulk is one with a load, for example of coal, that is loose and not stored in containers
laden.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: having or containing a lot of a particular thing
laden.translation[1].definitions[2].exam: an increase in bankruptcies among debt-laden corporations
The new version of the software is laden with useful features.
